title: string types
description: This schema defines types for strings

string.description: If a string depends in no case on a language and if no restrictions on the string are possible, then this type is used.

latinStringWithHyphens.description: If a string is limited to characters of the Latin alphabet and hyphens, then this type is used.

stringLatinDigitsPunctuation.description: If a string is limited to characters of the Latin alphabet, digits and punctuation, then this type is used.

fileName.description: File names must consist of printable characters which work on Linux, Winudows and Mac OSX.

xmlString.description: If a string is limited to valid characters in XML, then this type is used.

internationalString.description: It has been decided to keep everything in English so far. If other languages are included at a later stage, this structure makes it easy.
